intro: Sparrmannia abyssinica var. fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's sparrmannia, is a rare and unique variant of the Sparrmannia abyssinica species. It is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Ethiopia, where it thrives in high-altitude, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, including cold temperatures and poor soil quality. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
